intro: Fritillaria glabra var. qingchuanensis, commonly known as the Qingchuan fritillary, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Its bulbs are adapted to survive harsh environmental conditions, and it plays a significant role in local ecosystems. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts.
